_emerg_resp.FR_OtherRegulation: Applicable employees receive annual training on the ER Plan, monthly HazMat/Fire Brigade training is provided..

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
DSM Pharmaceuticals, Inc. manufactures both bulk active pharmaceutical ingredients and finished goods.  The materials are manufactured on a contract basis.  The DSM Facility has three covered processes:  Phosphorus Oxychloride, Chloroform and 37% Hydrochloric Acid.  In all three processes, storage containers do not exceed 55-gallon drums.  The chemical manufacturing portion of the DSM Facility are currrently being decommissioned.  It in expected that all chemical production will cease by 1/1/05 and the facility will not have any covered processes.  There have not been any releases in the last five years that have resulted in off-site consequences.  DSM's Emergency Services (Emergency response and spill management) Program can be described as follows:
The Greenville Site has in place an emergency organization consisting of the following support groups:
Chief Emergency Officer - The CEO will assume overall responsibility for the emergency except for a designated area around the actual incident scene that the on scene incident commander is responsible for.  The CEO will provide support and guidance to the incident commander.  A Production supervisor will assume the temporary CEO role during odd hours pending the arrival of the CEO.  The CEO will assume responsibility for coordination of all off-site activities and all site areas not affected by the incident.

Emergency Medical Response Team (EMRT's) - Trained medical personnel organized to provide assistance in the event of an emergency involving injury or illness.

Emergency Response Team - Consisting of fire fighters, HAZMAT team members and confined space rescue team members is provided for protection against fire, hazardous materials spills/releases and for rescue of victims in confined spaces.  All Emergency Response Team members will report to all alarms and will serve in a support role when not fully trained for the emergency (example-a confined space rescue specialist would serve in a support role during a HAZM

AT incident, etc.)

Environmental Services - Trained Environmental Engineers/Operators who provide technical expertise and advice in the event of an emergency involving a hazardous substance spill and /or release.

Safety Department - Trained safety personnel who provide technical expertise and advice in the event of any type of emergency.

Security - Trained security personnel who provide security and communications assistance in the event of any type of emergency.

Health Center - Trained nurses who provide assistance in the event of an emergency involving injury or illness.

Engineering Facilities and Utilities - Trained maintenance engineering personnel who provide technical expertise and advice in the event of an emergency involving fire/explosion, spills, releases, electrical, and/or severe weather.

Lab Support - Trained laboratory personnel who provide professional expertise and advice regarding analysis of chemical-related emergencies.

Emergency Communications Coordinator - Trained public relations personnel who are responsible for handling all contact with the media and public.

Safety Officer - Trained individual for specific monitoring of the incident assigned to ensure life safety codes are adhered to.  The safety officer will be appointed by the incident commander and will have the authority to suspend activities deemed unsafe.

Field Communication Coordinator/Advisors - Trained individuals who relay information from the incident scene to the CEO and others to improve communications.  May serve at the incident scene or in the Console.  This is an advisory role and is not in the command system.

Environmental Emergency Coordinator - Trained environmental engineering personnel who provide technical assistance and advice regarding county, state, and federal regulations during hazardous materials spills/releases.

Incident Commander - Coordinates overall efforts of Fire Brigade, HAZMAT & Confined Space Rescue Team during an emergency.  Delegates fire, HAZ

MAT or confined space rescue operations leaders as needed.  An emergency response team squad leader or a Production supervisor, depending upon the nature of the emergency may fill this role.  The incident commander has total control of the immediate area and the affected area of the incident, but his span of control will not extend off the site.

Emergency Services Coordinator - Serves as the administrator of the Emergency Response Team's activities.  Maintains budget to provide needed facilities, financier for procuring equipment, and providing training.  Stays abreast of OSHA and NFPA regulations to assure that the Reponse Team is adequately supplied and trained.  Responds to the incident scene or the Console during alarms. 

	Pitt County. Emergency Services Office - Organizations that provide Fire Protection, Rescue Squads, Law Enforcement Services, Pitt County Fire Marshall and Emergency Services Coordinator.  Pitt County Emergency Communications Center will dispatch all emergency organizations as requested by DSM harmaceuticals, Inc.

	Greenville Fire and Rescue - Trained firefighter and medical personnel who provide medical support and confined space rescue support during off-hours or when requested.  Provide back-up support for confined space rescue emergencies.

	Staton House Volunteer Fire Department - First on scene mutual aid unit.  Responds to all odd hour and weekend fire alarms.
